title: Unlocking Android
longDescription: Android is an open source mobile phone platform based OS...

title: Clean Code
shortDescription: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
longDescription: Even bad code can function. But if code isn't clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees.

title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
longDescription: JavaScript is a powerful programming language that has become the de facto language of the web.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
shortDescription: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey To Mastery
longDescription: The Pragmatic Programmer cuts through the increasing specialization and technicalities of modern software development to examine the core process â€” taking a requirement and producing working, maintainable code that delights its users.

title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
shortDescription: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
longDescription: Design Patterns is a modern classic in the literature of object-oriented development, offering timeless and elegant solutions to common problems in software design.

title: The Mythical Man-Month: Essays on Software Engineering
shortDescription: The Mythical Man-Month: Essays on Software Engineering
longDescription: The Mythical Man-Month is a classic book on the software project management, written by Fred Brooks. The book presents his personal view of managing software projects based on his experiences at IBM.

title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
shortDescription: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
longDescription: Refactoring is a controlled technique for improving the design of an existing code base. Its essence is applying a series of small behavior-preserving transformations

title: Domain-Driven Design: Tackling Complexity in the Heart of Software
shortDescription: Domain-Driven Design: Tackling Complexity in the Heart of Software
longDescription: Domain-Driven Design (DDD) is an approach to software development for complex needs by connecting the implementation to an evolving model. The premise of Domain-Driven Design is the following: placing the project's primary focus on the core domain and domain logic.

title: Head First Design Patterns
longDescription: Head First Design Patterns is a book that teaches you design patterns in a way that is engaging, memorable, and useful to you as a software developer. It introduces the key design patterns in a way that is both easy to understand and memorable.

title: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction
shortDescription: Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction
longDescription: Code Complete is a comprehensive guide to software construction that includes in-depth advice on everything from project design, construction, and debugging to testing and maintenance.

title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers
shortDescription: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers
longDescription: The Clean Coder describes the journey to professionalism that every software developer must make - from apprentice to journeyman to master.

title: Introduction to Algorithms
longDescription: Introduction to Algorithms is a book on computer programming by Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, and Clifford Stein.
